label: 蕃国
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: a subordinate and tribute-rendering realm. According to the Chinese ideal vision of their “middle kingdom,” rulers and peoples of peripheral realms recognized the supremacy of the Chinese monarch and paid him both obeissance and tribute. In the same way, peninsular kingdoms such as Silla and Paekche are sometimes depicted in Japanese records as bankoku of the tennô’s realm. [蕃国]
